Properties.Description: The maximum range the weapon can fire.
First burst is aimed at this offset relative to target position.
Each burst after the first lands by this offset away from the previous burst.
The sound played each time the weapon is fired.
Sound played only on first burst in a salvo.
The sound played when the weapon is reloaded.
Delay in ticks to play reloading sound.
Delay in ticks between reloading ammo magazines.
Number of shots in a single ammo magazine.
Can this weapon target the attacker itself?
What types of targets are affected.
What types of targets are unaffected. Overrules ValidTargets.
If weapon is not directly targeting an actor and targeted position is above this altitude, the weapon will ignore terrain target types and only check TargetTypeAir for validity.
Delay in ticks between firing shots from the same ammo magazine. If one entry, it will be used for all bursts. If multiple entries, their number needs to match Burst - 1.
The minimum range the weapon can fire.
Does this weapon aim at the target's center regardless of other targetable offsets?

WeaponTypes.Name: TeslaZap
WeaponTypes.Description: Instant-hit projectile used to create electricity-like effects.

Properties.Description: Sprite sequence to play at the center.
Sprite sequence to play at the borders.
The palette used to draw this electric zap.
How many sprite sequences to play at the center.
How many sprite sequences to play at the borders.
How long (in ticks) to play the sprite sequences.
How long (in ticks) until applying damage. Can't be longer than `Duration`
Follow the targeted actor when it moves.

WeaponTypes.Name: AreaBeam
WeaponTypes.Description: Beam projectile that travels in a straight line.

Properties.Description: Projectile speed in WDist / tick, two values indicate a randomly picked velocity per beam.
The maximum duration (in ticks) of each beam burst.
The number of ticks between the beam causing warhead impacts in its area of effect.
The width of the beam.
The shape of the beam.  Accepts values Cylindrical or Flat.
How far beyond the target the projectile keeps on travelling.
The minimum distance the beam travels.
Damage modifier applied at each range step.
Ranges at which each Falloff step is defined.
The maximum/constant/incremental inaccuracy used in conjunction with the InaccuracyType property.

Controls the way inaccuracy is calculated. Possible values are 'Maximum' - scale from 0 to max with range, 'PerCellIncrement' - scale from 0 with range and 'Absolute' - use set value regardless of range.
Can this projectile be blocked when hitting actors with an IBlocksProjectiles trait.
Does the beam follow the target.
Should the beam be visually rendered? False = Beam is invisible.
Equivalent to sequence ZOffset. Controls Z sorting.
Color of the beam.
Beam color is the player's color.

WeaponTypes.Name: Bullet
WeaponTypes.Description: Projectile that travels in a straight line or arc.

Properties.Description: Projectile speed in WDist / tick, two values indicate variable velocity.
The maximum/constant/incremental inaccuracy used in conjunction with the InaccuracyType property.

Controls the way inaccuracy is calculated. Possible values are 'Maximum' - scale from 0 to max with range, 'PerCellIncrement' - scale from 0 with range and 'Absolute' - use set value regardless of range.
Image to display.
Loop a randomly chosen sequence of Image from this list while this projectile is moving.
The palette used to draw this projectile.
Palette is a player palette BaseName
Does this projectile have a shadow?
Color to draw shadow if Shadow is true.
Trail animation.
Loop a randomly chosen sequence of TrailImage from this list while this projectile is moving.
Interval in ticks between each spawned Trail animation.
Delay in ticks until trail animation is spawned.
Palette used to render the trail sequence.
Use the Player Palette to render the trail sequence.
Is this blocked by actors with BlocksProjectiles trait.
Width of projectile (used for finding blocking actors).
Arc in WAngles, two values indicate variable arc.
Up to how many times does this bullet bounce when touching ground without hitting a target. 0 implies exploding on contact with the originally targeted position.
Modify distance of each bounce by this percentage of previous distance.
Sound to play when the projectile hits the ground, but not the target.
Terrain where the projectile explodes instead of bouncing.
Trigger the explosion if the projectile touches an actor thats owner has these player relationships.
Altitude above terrain below which to explode. Zero effectively deactivates airburst.
When set, display a line behind the actor. Length is measured in ticks after appearing.
Time (in ticks) after which the line should appear. Controls the distance to the actor.
Equivalent to sequence ZOffset. Controls Z sorting.
Thickness of the emitted line at the start of the contrail.
Thickness of the emitted line at the end of the contrail. Will default to ContrailStartWidth if left undefined
RGB color at the contrail start.
Use player remap color instead of a custom color at the contrail the start.
The alpha value [from 0 to 255] of color at the contrail the start.
RGB color at the contrail end. Will default to ContrailStartColor if left undefined
Use player remap color instead of a custom color at the contrail end.
The alpha value [from 0 to 255] of color at the contrail end.

WeaponTypes.Name: GravityBomb
WeaponTypes.Description: Projectile with customisable acceleration vector.

Properties.Description: Loop a randomly chosen sequence of Image from this list while falling.
Sequence to play when launched. Skipped if null or empty.
The palette used to draw this projectile.
Palette is a player palette BaseName
Does this projectile have a shadow?
Color to draw shadow if Shadow is true.
Projectile movement vector per tick (forward, right, up), use negative values for opposite directions.
Value added to Velocity every tick.

WeaponTypes.Name: InstantHit
WeaponTypes.Description: Instant, invisible, usually direct-on-target projectile.

Properties.Description: The maximum/constant/incremental inaccuracy used in conjunction with the InaccuracyType property.

Controls the way inaccuracy is calculated. Possible values are 'Maximum' - scale from 0 to max with range, 'PerCellIncrement' - scale from 0 with range and 'Absolute' - use set value regardless of range.
Projectile can be blocked.
The width of the projectile.

Scan radius for actors with projectile-blocking trait. If set to a negative value (default), it will automatically scale to the blocker with the largest health shape. Only set custom values if you know what you're doing.

WeaponTypes.Name: LaserZap
WeaponTypes.Description: Not a sprite, but an engine effect.

Properties.Description: The width of the zap.
The shape of the beam.  Accepts values Cylindrical or Flat.
Equivalent to sequence ZOffset. Controls Z sorting.
The maximum duration (in ticks) of the beam's existence.
Total time-frame in ticks that the beam deals damage every DamageInterval.
The number of ticks between the beam causing warhead impacts in its area of effect.
Color of the beam.
Beam follows the target.
The maximum/constant/incremental inaccuracy used in conjunction with the InaccuracyType property.

Controls the way inaccuracy is calculated. Possible values are 'Maximum' - scale from 0 to max with range, 'PerCellIncrement' - scale from 0 with range and 'Absolute' - use set value regardless of range.
Beam can be blocked.
Draw a second beam (for 'glow' effect).
The width of the zap.
The shape of the beam.  Accepts values Cylindrical or Flat.
Equivalent to sequence ZOffset. Controls Z sorting.
Color of the secondary beam.
Impact animation.
Sequence of impact animation to use.
Image containing launch effect sequence.
Launch effect sequence to play.
Palette to use for launch effect.

WeaponTypes.Name: Missile
WeaponTypes.Description: Projectile with smart tracking.

Properties.Description: Name of the image containing the projectile sequence.
Loop a randomly chosen sequence of Image from this list while this projectile is moving.
Palette used to render the projectile sequence.
Palette is a player palette BaseName
Does this projectile have a shadow?
Color to draw shadow if Shadow is true.
Minimum vertical launch angle (pitch).
Maximum vertical launch angle (pitch).
Minimum launch speed in WDist / tick. Defaults to Speed if -1.
Maximum launch speed in WDist / tick. Defaults to Speed if -1.
Maximum projectile speed in WDist / tick
Projectile acceleration when propulsion activated.
How many ticks before this missile is armed and can explode.
Is the missile blocked by actors with BlocksProjectiles: trait.
Is the missile aware of terrain height levels. Only needed for mods with real, non-visual height levels.
Width of projectile (used for finding blocking actors).
The maximum/constant/incremental inaccuracy used in conjunction with the InaccuracyType property.

Controls the way inaccuracy is calculated. Possible values are 'Maximum' - scale from 0 to max with range, 'PerCellIncrement' - scale from 0 with range and 'Absolute' - use set value regardless of range.
Inaccuracy override when successfully locked onto target. Defaults to Inaccuracy if negative.
Probability of locking onto and following target.
Horizontal rate of turn.
Vertical rate of turn.
Gravity applied while in free fall.
Run out of fuel after covering this distance. Zero for defaulting to weapon range. Negative for unlimited fuel.
Explode when running out of fuel.
Altitude above terrain below which to explode. Zero effectively deactivates airburst.
Cruise altitude. Zero means no cruise altitude used.
Activate homing mechanism after this many ticks.
Image that contains the trail animation.
Loop a randomly chosen sequence of TrailImage from this list while this projectile is moving.
Palette used to render the trail sequence.
Use the Player Palette to render the trail sequence.
Interval in ticks between spawning trail animation.
Should trail animation be spawned when the propulsion is not activated.
When set, display a line behind the actor. Length is measured in ticks after appearing.
Time (in ticks) after which the line should appear. Controls the distance to the actor.
Equivalent to sequence ZOffset. Controls Z sorting.
Thickness of the emitted line at the start of the contrail.
Thickness of the emitted line at the end of the contrail. Will default to ContrailStartWidth if left undefined
RGB color at the contrail start.
Use player remap color instead of a custom color at the contrail the start.
The alpha value [from 0 to 255] of color at the contrail the start.
RGB color at the contrail end. Will default to ContrailStartColor if left undefined
Use player remap color instead of a custom color at the contrail end.
The alpha value [from 0 to 255] of color at the contrail end.
Should missile targeting be thrown off by nearby actors with JamsMissiles.
Range of facings by which jammed missiles can stray from current path.
Explodes when leaving the following terrain type, e.g., Water for torpedoes.
Allow the missile to snap to the target, meaning jumping to the target immediately when the missile enters the radius of the current speed around the target.
Explodes when inside this proximity radius to target. Note: If this value is lower than the missile speed, this check might not trigger fast enough, causing the missile to fly past the target.

WeaponTypes.Name: Railgun
WeaponTypes.Description: Laser effect with helix coiling around.

Properties.Description: Damage all units hit by the beam instead of just the target?
The maximum/constant/incremental inaccuracy used in conjunction with the InaccuracyType property.

Controls the way inaccuracy is calculated. Possible values are 'Maximum' - scale from 0 to max with range, 'PerCellIncrement' - scale from 0 with range and 'Absolute' - use set value regardless of range.
Can this projectile be blocked when hitting actors with an IBlocksProjectiles trait.
Duration of the beam and helix
Equivalent to sequence ZOffset. Controls Z sorting.
The width of the main trajectory. ("beam").
The shape of the beam.  Accepts values Cylindrical or Flat.
Beam color in (A),R,G,B.
When true, this will override BeamColor parameter and draw the laser with player color. (Still uses BeamColor's alpha information)
Beam alpha gets + this value per tick during drawing; hence negative value makes it fade over time.
Thickness of the helix
The radius of the spiral effect. (WDist)
Height of one complete helix turn, measured parallel to the axis of the helix (WDist)
Helix radius gets + this value per tick during drawing
Helix alpha gets + this value per tick during drawing; hence negative value makes it fade over time.
Helix spins by this much over time each tick.
Draw each cycle of helix with this many quantization steps
Helix color in (A),R,G,B.
Draw helix in PlayerColor? Overrides RGB part of the HelixColor. (Still uses HelixColor's alpha information)
Impact animation.
Sequence of impact animation to use.
